sn1.36:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn1.36:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, a number of devatās belonging to the Satullapa host, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One. Having approached, they paid homage to the Blessed One and stood to one side.
sn1.36:1.3: Then one devatā, standing to one side, recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.36:2.2: If lack of faith does not persist,
sn1.36:2.3: Fame and renown thereby come to him,
sn1.36:2.4: And he goes to heaven on leaving the body. ”
sn1.36:3.1: Then another devatā recited these verses in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn1.36:4.1: “One should discard anger, cast off conceit,
sn1.36:4.3: Who does not adhere to name-and-form.
sn1.36:4.4: No ties torment one who has nothing, ”
sn1.36:5.3: But the wise man guards diligence
sn1.36:6.2: Don’t be intimate with sensual delight.
